thread.title: The four ickiest things you never want to touch on a plane
thread.title_full: The four ickiest things you never want to touch on a plane

author: Mary Forgione
title: The four ickiest things you never want to touch on a plane
text:
The four ickiest things you never want to touch on a plane Airbus A350 XWB in Bogota Carlos Meneses / EPA 
Beware of bacteria-laden tray tables when you get on your next flight. It's the germiest part of the aircraft. 
Beware of bacteria-laden tray tables when you get on your next flight. It's the germiest part of the aircraft. (Carlos Meneses / EPA) Scientific Research 
I'm no germophobe, but I was surprised to learn the dirtiest place on an airplane wasn't the bathroom. Travelers, it's that tray table right in front of you that apparently carries more living bacteria per square inch than any other public part of the plane. See the most-read stories in Life & Style this hour >> Open link 
"Since this could provide bacteria direct transmission to your mouth, a clear takeaway from this is to eliminate any direct contact your food has with the tray table," says Travelmath , a trip-calculating website that sent a microbiologist out to collect samples. 
"Itâ€™s also advisable to bring hand sanitizer for any other dirty surface you may touch along your journey." 
Check and check. 
And make sure you have enough wipes to cover these next-ickiest places: the toilet flush button followed by the seatbelt buckle (no excuse not to buckle up) and the overhead air vent.
